title: Kayako: auto-reply mail changes.
description:
We should set expectations for response time in our auto-reply mail. 

We can get text from support handbook for Case Priority / Problem Severity / Response Goals and perhaps a link to the support handbook.

changeHistory.comment:
Additional content to add in the auto reply e-mail

•	Options for getting support if you’re not a customer (e.g. dev community)
•	How to report bugs if you’re not a customer (how should we do that? Via dev community, or should we take bugs on the support alias, since we get the mails anyway? (let's discuss)
•	As we discussed before, a recap of what to expect in terms of response time.
For the bounced e-mails (from customer that does not have an account),  CC: account-requests@marklogic.com.

For reference - the current automated responses are listed below:
--------------

1.       Current text of the autoresponse for “support” for people who *have* an account
Alex Bleasdale,

Thank you for contacting us. This is an automated response confirming the receipt of your ticket. One of our agents will get back to you as soon as possible. For your records, the details of the ticket are listed below. When replying, please make sure that the ticket ID is kept in the subject line to ensure that your replies are tracked appropriately.

   Ticket ID: 12389
   Subject: response test - please ignore....
   Department: Support Tickets
   Type: Issue
   Status: Open
   Priority: Medium

You can check the status of or reply to this ticket online at: https://help.marklogic.com/Tickets/Ticket/View/12389

Kind regards,

MarkLogic
________________________________________
Support Center: https://help.marklogic.com


2.       Current text of the autoresponse for “support” for people who *don’t have* and account
===============================================================================================
Your ticket has not been accepted into the system because you do not have an account. If you have a current MarkLogic maintenance contract, you can request an account by emailing: account-requests@marklogic.com

Once registered, you will be able to submit tickets directly by sending us an email or by visiting our support portal at https://help.marklogic.com. We are sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.
Support Center: https://help.marklogic.com


3.       Current text of the autoresponse for “account requests”
================================================================
N/A 
The page (on help.marklogic.com) has the following wording:

If you are a MarkLogic customer with an active maintenance contract, you can request an account by emailing:

account-requests@marklogic.com 


4.       If the autoresponse for “urgent” is different from “support”, current text for that.
=============================================================================================
N/A
I think the response is the same as the standard kayako "ticket has been created" response.  E.G. Nothing further reported

If you don't have an account:
Your ticket has not been accepted into the system because you do not have an account. If you have a current MarkLogic maintenance contract, you can request an account by emailing: account-requests@marklogic.com

Once registered, you will be able to submit tickets directly by sending us an email or by visiting our support portal at https://help.marklogic.com. We are sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.
Support Center: https://help.marklogic.com

* And I can confirm that we DO get paged *

5.       If the autoresponse for “urgent” is not different from “support”, whether it could be different.
========================================================================================================
This - I imagine, could easily be handled either at the Kayako level (some kind of trigger) or an autoresponder on the exchange server...
For auto response for those not a support contact add something to the effect of  "We also offer a paid support program that includes.... To learn more, contact sales@marklogic.com“
